title: Are Chetan Bhagat books really good? - Quora

response.answer_text: Firstly watch this vedio:  Secondly read few pages randomly from a Chetan Bhagat novel. Thirdly, answer the question: What similarity did you find in the video and the content of CB novel. Look at the guys in Dhinchak Pooja’s video. They enjoy being in the video as much as CB’s fans enjoy reading his novels. Masses will enjoy stuff like that! Logically speaking, a novel must have its elements intact- just telling a story in simple words or difficult for that case isn't enough. There are no literary devices, and no art of literature in Chetan Bhagat’s novels. His thinking is on the surface, and not suitable for literature. This discourages literature students and those who appreciate literature and art. In fact, his novels are regressive to the progress of literature! Conclusively, Chetan Bhagat is Dhinchak Pooja of literature. He does to novels what she does to singing. No wonder masses follow both of them.

Chetan Bhagat novels revolves around the trending social issue or psychology. I have read almost all of his novels and personally i don’t get attached to the plot so much. He tries to choose a plot which in turn is a heated issue prevailing in the Indian society. This is the real reason why his novels get controversial. Talking about the main content of the books, they do are entertaining but not onto the extent which would make me read them once again. At last i would say that he is great author with a huge understanding of the society along with a power to express them through catchy plots.

I think Chetan bhagat books are really good for teenagers because he writes books in all aspects of teenagers from “dream to study in IIT to a girlfriend which is just half” which is a great part of his literature. Jokes apart, I really like his literature and read almost all novels of Chetan Bhagat.
